</DIV>
<A NAME="A12312015-VTRNDOCUMENT_HTM_S8E77868711955507A548287FE48B4FAC">
</A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTE 18.&#160;&#160;ACQUISITIONS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	E-Source
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Holdings Transaction
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Effective October 1, 2013 , the Company (through Vertex Operating, LLC, the Company&#8217;s wholly-owned subsidiary, &#8220;Vertex Operating&#8221;) acquired a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	51%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;interest in E-Source Holdings, LLC (&#8220;E-Source&#8221;), a company that leases and operates a facility located in Houston, Texas, and provides dismantling, demolition, decommission and marine salvage services at industrial facilities throughout the Gulf Coast. E-Source also owns and operates a fleet of trucks and other vehicles used for shipping and handling equipment and scrap materials. The consideration paid for the acquisition of E-Source was approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$900,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and the right of one of the sellers (the &#8220;Earn-Out Seller&#8221;) to earn additional earn-out payments of up to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	15%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of E-Source&#8217;s net income before taxes (valued at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$748,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;at the time of acquisition), in the event certain calendar year net income thresholds are met, in calendar years 2014 through 2017, as well as a commission of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	20%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the net income before taxes associated with certain future planned projects of E-Source required to be completed prior to December 31, 2014, as long as such applicable seller remains an employee of E-Source during such applicable periods. Effective on March 14, 2014, we entered into an amendment to our acquisition agreement with the Earn-Out Seller, and mutually agreed that the lesser of (a)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	20%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and (b)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$100,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, per calendar year of earn-out payments due the Earn-Out Seller, if any, will be payable in shares of our restricted common stock, based on the average of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;closing sales prices of the Company&#8217;s common stock on the first
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;trading days of each applicable calendar year (each a &#8220;Valuation&#8221;) for which the earn-out consideration relates, provided that the parties mutually agreed to use a valuation of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.2922
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share (the &#8220;2014 Valuation Price&#8221;) for any earn-out payments relating to the 2014 calendar year and further agreed that in no event will any future calendar year Valuation be less than the 2014 Valuation Price. On March 26, 2014, but effective January 1, 2014, the Company acquired an additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	19%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;interest in E-Source for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$854,050
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in cash consideration and the right to receive stock consideration (on January 31, 2015) in the amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	207,743
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of stock subject to certain performance metrics being met during 2014.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In August 2014, Vertex Operating acquired the remaining
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	30%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;interest in E-Source, in consideration for the issuance of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	207,743
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of Company common stock and confirmation by the parties that the performance metrics relating to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	207,743
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of common stock issuable in connection with the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	19%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;acquisition would not be met. The transaction was recorded as additional paid in capital and a reduction of the non-controlling interest in accordance with ASC 810-10-45. Concurrent with the transaction, the Company paid
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$136,662
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;against the original contingent earn-out liability of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$748,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and wrote off
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$611,338
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;because certain terms of the contingent consideration agreement were not met by the acquiree. Following this transaction, E-Source became a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	100%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;wholly-owned subsidiary of Vertex Operating.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	E-Source leases and operates a facility located in Houston, Texas, and provides dismantling, demolition, decommission and marine salvage services at industrial facilities throughout the Gulf Coast.&#160;&#160;&#160;E-Source also owns and operates a fleet of trucks and other vehicles used for shipping and handling equipment and scrap materials.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Omega Refining Transaction
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On May 2, 2014, the Company completed its acquisition of substantially all of the assets of Omega Refining, LLC (including the Marrero, Louisiana re-refinery and Omega&#8217;s Myrtle Grove complex in Belle Chasse, Louisiana ("Omega Refining") and ownership of Golden State Lubricant Works, LLC for the purpose of re-refining used lubricating oils into processed oils and other products for the distribution, supply and sale to end-customers with related products and support services. The purchase price paid at the closing was approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$28,764,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in cash,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	500,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of our restricted common stock (valued at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3,266,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	) and the
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-35
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage119"></A>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	assumption of certain capital lease obligations and other liabilities relating to contracts and leases of Omega Refining in connection with the initial closing.&#160;&#160;We also agreed to provide Omega Holdings LLC ("Omega Holdings") a loan in the amount of up to approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$13,800,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The acquisition was accounted for under the purchase method of accounting, with the Company identified as the acquirer. Under the purchase method of accounting, the aggregate amount of consideration paid by the Company was allocated to Omega Refining's net tangible assets and intangible assets based on their estimated fair values as of May&#160;2, 2014.&#160;The transaction resulted in a bargain purchase of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$6,574,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;recognized in net income as an acquisition-date gain. During the twelve month period ending December 31, 2014, an additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$92,635
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;bargain purchase gain was recognized after capital lease balances were trued up, resulting in a total bargain purchase gain of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$6,574,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The Omega Refining purchase qualifies as a bargain purchase since the acquisition date amounts of the identifiable net asset acquired, excluding goodwill (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$39,010,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	), exceed the value of the consideration transferred (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$32,436,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	). The difference of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$6,574,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;is a gain as of the acquisition date. The bargain purchase resulted from the financial distress that Omega was in due to the large amount of debt held by Omega and the unexpected decrease in crack spreads that made the debt level overbearing. The Company retained an independent third party to assist management in determining the fair value of tangible and intangible assets transferred and liabilities assumed. The allocation of the purchase price is based on the best estimates of management.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The following information summarizes the allocation of the fair values assigned to the assets at the purchase date:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	)

</TR>
<TR>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Gain on purchase
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;PADDING-RIGHT:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="2" STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BORDER-BOTTOM:2PX SOLID #000000;PADDING-LEFT:2PX;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	(6,574,000
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>

	Heartland Purchase Agreement

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

	Vertex OH

	Vertex Operating

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8221;).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	In connection with the Closing, we acquired substantially all of the assets of Heartland related to and used in an oil re-refinery and, in connection with the collecting, aggregating and purchasing of used lubricating oils and the re-refining of such oils into processed oils and other products for the distribution, supply and sale to end-customers, including raw materials, finished products and work-in-process, equipment and other fixed assets, customer lists and marketing information, the name &#8216;Heartland&#8217; and other related trade names, Heartland&#8217;s real property relating to its used oil refining facility located in Columbus, Ohio, used oil storage and transfer facilities located in Columbus, Zanesville and Norwalk, Ohio (provided that the acquisition of the Norwalk, Ohio location is subject to the terms and conditions of an amendment of the Heartland Agreement, and leases related to storage and transfer facilities located in Zanesville, Ohio, Mount Sterling, Kentucky, and Ravenswood, West Virginia (collectively, the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Heartland Assets
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8221;) and assumed certain liabilities of Heartland associated with certain assumed and acquired agreements (collectively, the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Acquired Business
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8221;). The main assets excluded from the purchased assets pursuant to the Heartland Purchase Agreement were Heartland&#8217;s cash and cash equivalents, receivables, certain prepaid expenses, refunds and related claims, rights to certain tax refunds, certain assets used in the operations of Heartland which are used more than incidentally by Heartland&#8217;s majority equity owner (Warren Distribution, Inc. (&#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Warren
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8221;)) in connection with the operation of its other businesses and certain real property.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The purchase price paid in consideration for the Heartland Assets was the assumption of the assumed liabilities and an aggregate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	2,257,467
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of restricted common stock (the &#8220;Heartland Shares&#8221;), representing a total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1,189,637
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares which had an agreed upon value between the parties of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$8,276,792
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;as agreed pursuant to the terms of the original Heartland Purchase Agreement,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	303,957
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares which were due in consideration for the purchase of various inventory of Heartland acquired by the Company at the closing in connection with the Inventory Purchase (described below, which number includes the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	56,180
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares issued in April 2015), valued at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$792,270
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, and a total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	763,873
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares due in consideration for the Reimbursement of Operating Losses (described below). A total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	150,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of restricted common stock issued at the Closing are being held in escrow and will be used to satisfy indemnification claims (the &#8220;Escrow Shares&#8221;). Pursuant to the Heartland Purchase Agreement, the parties agreed to a true up of the inventory acquired at Closing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	sixty days
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;after the Closing (February 3, 2015). Pursuant to the true up, any additional amount owed by the Company to Heartland for inventory at Closing (less amounts already paid for at Closing) was to be paid in shares of the Company&#8217;s restricted common stock, based on the volume weighted average prices of the Company&#8217;s common stock on the NASDAQ Capital Market (&#8220;VWAP&#8221;) on the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	ten
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;(10) trading days immediately prior to Closing, which totaled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.56
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. An aggregate of an additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$200,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was owed to Heartland in connection with the inventory true-up and as such, we issued Heartland an additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	56,180
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of restricted common stock (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$200,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;divided by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.56
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	) in connection with such obligation in April 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The acquisition was accounted for under the purchase method of accounting, with the Company identified as the acquirer. Under the purchase method of accounting, the aggregate amount of consideration paid by the Company was allocated to Heartland&#8217;s net tangible assets and intangible assets based on their estimated fair values as of December 5, 2014. The transaction resulted in a bargain purchase of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$375,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;recognized in net income as an acquisition-date gain. The Heartland purchase qualifies as a bargain
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-37
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage121"></A>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	purchase since the acquisition date amounts of the identifiable net asset acquired, excluding goodwill (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$12,382,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	), exceed the value of the consideration transferred (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$12,007,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	). The difference of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$375,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;is a gain as of the acquisition date. The bargain purchase resulted from the financial distress that Heartland was in due to the large amount of debt held by Heartland and the unexpected decrease in crack spreads that made the debt level overbearing. The Company retained an independent third party to assist management in determining the fair value of tangible and intangible assets transferred and liabilities assumed. The allocation of the purchase price is based on the best estimates of management.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Additionally, as described below, an Inventory True-Up occurred
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	60
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;days after Closing.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The parties agreed that any amount due to Heartland in consideration for inventory on hand which was purchased at Closing, based on a preliminary valuation of such inventory by the parties, would be paid in shares of the Company&#8217;s restricted common stock, based on the volume weighted average prices of the Company&#8217;s common stock on the NASDAQ Capital Market on the ten (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	) trading days (the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	VWAP
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8221;) immediately prior to closing (the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Inventory Purchase
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8221;), which totaled
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3.56
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;(the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Closing VWAP
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8221;), and as such Heartland was issued an additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	56,180
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of restricted common stock in 2015 (the "
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Inventory True-Up"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Contingent Liability related to the Heartland Purchase Agreement:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Heartland also has the right pursuant to the terms of the Heartland Purchase Agreement to earn additional earn-out consideration of up to a maximum of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$8,276,792
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, based on total EBITDA related to the Heartland Business during the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	twelve
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;month period beginning on the first day of the first full calendar month commencing on or after the first anniversary of the closing (the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Earnout Period
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8221;), as follows (as applicable, the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Contingent Payment
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8221;):
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Any Contingent Payment due is payable
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in cash and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock based on the volume-weighted average of the regular session closing prices per share of the Company&#8217;s common stock on the NASDAQ Capital Market for the ten (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	) consecutive trading days commencing on the trading day immediately following the last day of the Earnout Period and ending on such tenth trading day thereafter.&#160;&#160;Additionally, the amount of any Contingent Payment is reduced by two-thirds of the cumulative total of required capital expenditures incurred at Heartland&#8217;s refining facility in Columbus, Ohio, which are paid or funded by Vertex OH after the Closing, not to exceed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$866,667
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, which capital expenditures are estimated to total
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in aggregate.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Notwithstanding the above, the maximum number of shares of common stock to be issued pursuant to the Heartland Purchase Agreement cannot (i) exceed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	19.9%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the outstanding shares of common stock outstanding on October 21, 2014, (ii) exceed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	19.9%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the combined voting power of the Company on October 21, 2014, or (iii) otherwise exceed such number of shares of common stock that would violate applicable listing rules of the NASDAQ Stock Market in the event the Company&#8217;s stockholders do not approve the issuance of such shares (the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Share Cap
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8221;).&#160;&#160;In the event the number of shares to be issued under the Heartland Purchase Agreement exceeds the Share Cap, then Vertex OH is required to instead pay any such additional consideration in cash or obtain the approval of the Company&#8217;s stockholders under applicable rules and requirements of the NASDAQ Capital Market for the additional issuance of shares.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Additionally, we were required to file a registration statement within
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	135
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;days of the Closing registering at least
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1,189,637
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock and use commercially reasonable efforts to obtain effectiveness of the registration statement within
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	30
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;days of the filing date if the SEC does not review the registration statement or within
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	105
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;days of the filing date if the SEC does review the registration statement filing, which registration statement was timely and became effective within the required time period.&#160;Pursuant to the Heartland Purchase Agreement, Heartland agreed to not sell more than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	50,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock each week, if otherwise permitted pursuant to applicable law and regulation.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-38
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Aaron Oil Acquisition
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Effective August 6, 2015, H&amp;H Oil acquired a collection route consisting of collecting, shipping and selling used oil, oil filters, antifreeze and other related services in the state of Louisiana, but excluding industrial customers, maritime customers, off shore customers, dockside locations, industrial services, used absorbent services, wastewater generating customers and collectors/ transporters of crankcase used oil, petroleum fuel reclamation customers and crude oil producers/processing/recovery/reclamation customers of Aaron Oil Company, Inc. (&#8220;Aaron Oil&#8221;). Included in the purchase were certain trucks and other assets owned by Aaron Oil and certain contract rights. The President, Chief Executive Officer and owner of Aaron Oil is Dan Cowart, the brother of our Chief Executive Officer and largest stockholder, Benjamin P. Cowart. The acquisition price paid at closing was approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, which included a reimbursement for certain prepaid contract rights. Aaron Oil also agreed to provide account servicing
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-39
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage123"></A>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	services to us for a period of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	sixty days
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;following the closing at an agreed upon price per gallon of oil serviced. Aaron Oil also agreed to a non-compete provision prohibiting Aaron Oil from competing against the Company in the Louisiana market for a period of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	two years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;from the closing.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<A NAME="A12312015-VTRNDOCUMENT_HTM_SBC17EE1FD45B50DE8448B53AB660CC6C">
</A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTE 19.&#160;&#160;CONTINGENT CONSIDERATION
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As part of the consideration paid for Heartland (see Note 18), the Company has agreed to pay the seller additional earn-out consideration of up to a maximum of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$8,276,792
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, based on total EBITDA related to the Heartland Business during the twelve month period beginning on the first day of the first full calendar month commencing on or after the first anniversary of the closing. Any qualified Contingent Payment would be payable
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in cash and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock. Additionally, the amount of any Contingent Payment would be reduced by two-thirds of the cumulative total of required capital expenditures incurred at Heartland&#8217;s refining facility in Columbus, Ohio, which are paid or funded by Vertex OH after the Closing, not to exceed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$866,667
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. These capital expenditures are estimated to total
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in aggregate.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	As of December 31, 2015 the Company estimates, based on the current performance of Heartland and projections for all covered future periods, it is unlikely that this contingent liability/potential earn-out payments transaction with Heartland will be realized. Because of this, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$6,069,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;contingent liability that had previously been recorded on the Balance Sheet for December 31, 2014 was reversed back to income for the year ending December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<A NAME="A12312015-VTRNDOCUMENT_HTM_S07431E7EF0BD5B53B3A5189B0D824CE3">
</A>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BOTTOM;BACKGROUND-COLOR:#CCEEFF;PADDING-TOP:2PX;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PX;">

</FONT>

<A NAME="A12312015-VTRNDOCUMENT_HTM_S16E71F438D4055CFBEA449044B4431DC">
</A>
<EFX_SUBSEQUENT_EVENTS>
<A NAME="FIS_SUBSEQUENT_EVENTS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NOTE 21. SUBSEQUENT EVENTS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Effective on or around January 21, 2016, we paid the January 2016 rent due pursuant to the terms of the Bango Lease in shares of our common stock, pursuant to the terms of such lease, which allows us to pay
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	110%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the rent which would otherwise be due in cash (i.e.,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$268,400
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of share based rent compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$244,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of cash based rent), as calculated using the volume weighted average price (&#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	VWAP
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8221;) of our common stock for the 10-day period preceding the first day of each month, which VWAP for the month of January 2016 was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.10
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share. As such, we issued the then owner of Bango Oil, Fox Encore, an aggregate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	244,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of our restricted common stock in lieu of cash rent due pursuant to the Bango Lease for the month of January 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Purchase and Sale Agreement, Churchill County, Nevada Plant:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On January 28, 2016, we entered into an Asset Purchase Agreement (the &#8220;Sale Agreement&#8221;) with Vertex Operating and its wholly-owned subsidiary, Vertex Refining Nevada, LLC ("
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Vertex Refining Nevada
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	"), Bango Oil, LLC (&#8220;Bango Oil&#8221;)(provided that Bango Oil did not become a party to the agreement until we exercised the Purchase Option, described below) and Safety-Kleen Systems, Inc. (&#8220;Safety-Kleen&#8221;).&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-40
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage124"></A>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Pursuant to the Sale Agreement, which closed on January 29, 2016, we (through Bango Oil after we acquired Bango Oil as described below pursuant to our exercise of the Purchase Option) sold Safety-Kleen the used oil re-refining plant located on approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	40
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;acres in Churchill County, Nevada (the &#8220;Bango Plant&#8221;), which we previously rented, and all equipment, tools and other tangible personal property located at the Bango Plant, which relate to or are used in connection with the operations of the Bango Plant (collectively, the &#8220;Bango Assets&#8221;). Safety-Kleen assumed certain liabilities associated with contracts assumed in the purchase and related to bringing the Bango Plant back into operational status. The aggregate purchase price for the Bango Assets was
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$35 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, subject to adjustment as described in the Sale Agreement for certain taxes, costs and expenses incurred by Safety-Kleen after closing. A total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the purchase price was used by us in order to exercise the options we had pursuant to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;Lease and Purchase Agreements (the &#8220;Equipment Leases&#8221;) we were party to, which provided for the use of a rail facility and related equipment and a pre-fabricated metal building located at the Fallon, Nevada, facility, and which provided us (through Vertex Refining Nevada) the right to acquire the applicable property/equipment subject to each Equipment Lease at any time prior to the expiration of the leases for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$914,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$400,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, respectively. Additionally,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$100,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the purchase price was retained by Safety-Kleen to acquire certain water rights necessary for operation of the Bango Plant. Finally, a required closing condition of the Sale Agreement was that we use a portion of the purchase price to exercise the purchase option set forth in that certain Lease With Option For Membership Interest Purchase (the &#8220;Bango Lease&#8221;) entered into on April 30, 2015, by and between us, Vertex Refining Nevada and Bango Oil, whereby, we had the option at any time during the term of the lease to purchase all of the equity interests of Bango Oil (the &#8220;Purchase Option&#8221;), effectively acquiring ownership of the Bango Plant. The Purchase Option was exercised by us on January 29, 2016 in connection with the closing of the Sale Agreement, at which time Bango Oil became a wholly-owned subsidiary of Vertex Refining Nevada, and we paid approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of consideration to Bango Oil in connection with the Purchase Option as described in greater detail below under &#8220;Membership Interest Purchase Agreement&#8221;. The terms of the Bango Lease and Equipment Leases are described in greater detail in the Current Report on Form 8-K filed by the Company with the Securities and Exchange Commission on May 5, 2015. Additionally, an aggregate of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$16 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the purchase price paid by Safety-Kleen in connection with the Sale Agreement was required to be paid by us to our senior lender, Goldman Sachs Bank USA, at closing, which amount was paid at closing, and which funds were used to pay down amounts owed to Goldman Sachs Bank USA under our Credit Agreement, as described in greater detail below under &#8220;Amended and Restated Credit and Guaranty Agreement&#8221;.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Additionally, at the closing, we placed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in cash and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;worth of our common stock (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	1,101,928
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares) into escrow with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	50%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the shares to be released
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	12 months
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;following the closing and such cash and the remainder of the shares held in escrow to be released
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	18 months
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;after the closing, in order to satisfy any indemnification claims made by Safety-Kleen pursuant to the terms of the Sale Agreement. On June 30 and December 31 of each year that any of our shares of common stock are in escrow, in the event the value of the shares held in escrow is less than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, based on the then market price of our common stock, we are required to increase the number of shares of common stock held in escrow to total
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in aggregate value.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Sale Agreement includes standard indemnification obligations of the parties, subject to certain caps on indemnification and deductibles. The closing of the transactions contemplated by the Sale Agreement was subject to usual and customary closing conditions, including requiring that we and Safety-Kleen enter into a Swap Agreement and Base Oil Agreement (each as described in greater detail below), all of which were satisfied prior to or at closing.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Sale Agreement includes a provision preventing us from directly or indirectly, hiring or soliciting any person who is or was employed in the operations conducted at the Bango Plant for a period of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	five
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;(5) years after the closing, except pursuant to a general solicitation which is not directed specifically to any such employees; provided, that nothing prohibits the Company from hiring (i) any employee whose employment has been terminated by Safety-Kleen or (ii) after
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	180 days
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;from the date of termination of employment, any employee whose employment has been terminated by the employee.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Houlihan Lokey acted as exclusive financial advisor to the Company in connection with the transaction.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Company received net cash of approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$17.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;in connection with the transactions contemplated by the Sale Agreement, after deducting legal, administrative and banker fees; amounts paid in connection with the exercise of the Purchase Option; cash amounts set aside in escrow; and the purchase price of the equipment related to the Bango Plant as described above, of which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$16 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was immediately paid to the Lender (defined below under &#8220;Amended and Restated Credit and Guaranty Agreement&#8221;) to pay down amounts owed to Lender under the Credit Agreement (defined below under &#8220;Amended and Restated Credit and Guaranty Agreement&#8221;).&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-41
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage125"></A>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Swap Agreement and Base Oil Agreement:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	A required condition to closing the transactions contemplated by the Sale Agreement was that we (through Vertex Operating) and Safety-Kleen enter into a Swap Agreement (the &#8220;Swap Agreement&#8221;), which was entered into on January 29, 2016. The Swap Agreement has a term of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	five years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, beginning when the Bango Plant is operational, and automatically renews for additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	one year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;terms thereafter unless either party provides the other
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	90 days
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;prior written notice of their intention not to renew prior to any automatic extension. Pursuant to the Swap Agreement, we and Safety-Kleen agreed to swap certain quantities of used oil feedstock (the agreement includes monthly maximums, quarterly minimums and maximums, and annual maximums of used oil feedstock volume required to be &#8216;swapped&#8217;) between the Bango Plant (which will then be owned and operated by Safety-Kleen) and our Marrero, Louisiana plant and/or the Cedar Marine Terminal in Baytown, Texas, on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis, with any shortfall in the amount of used oil feedstock &#8216;swapped&#8217; on a quarterly basis, being paid for in cash based on a discount to U.S. Platts mid-range per gallon rate for Gulf Coast No. 6, 3% oil (the &#8220;Platts&#8221;). The Swap Agreement can be terminated with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	30 days
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;prior written notice in the event either party fails to meet the specifications for oil feedstock set forth in the agreement, a party fails to deliver the required minimum quarterly volumes of oil feedstock during any three consecutive quarters, or a party materially breaches a term of the agreement.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Additionally, we (through Vertex Operating) and Safety-Kleen also entered into a Base Oil Agreement in connection with, and as a required condition of, the closing (the &#8220;Base Oil Agreement&#8221;). The Base Oil Agreement provides for us to purchase from Safety-Kleen, and Safety-Kleen to sell to us, certain required quantities of base oils and other finished lubricants described in greater detail in the Base Oil Agreement (the &#8220;Base Oil&#8221;)(the agreement contains quarterly and annual maximum volumes of Base Oil to be acquired by us). The agreement has a term of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	five years
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;and automatically renews for additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	one year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;terms thereafter unless either party provides the other
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	90 days
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;prior written notice of their intention not to renew prior to any automatic extension.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Membership Interest Purchase Agreement:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Pursuant to a Membership Interest Purchase Agreement entered into in connection with the closing of the Sale Agreement, by and among Vertex Refining Nevada, as buyer, Fox Encore 05 LLC, the sole owner of Bango Oil, as seller (&#8220;Fox Encore&#8221;), and certain other parties, Vertex Refining Nevada acquired
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	100%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of Bango Oil pursuant to the Purchase Option described above under &#8220;Purchase and Sale Agreement, Churchill County, Nevada Plant&#8221;. The purchase price payable by Vertex Refining Nevada to Fox Encore was approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	, which funds were paid with proceeds received pursuant to the Sale Agreement. The Membership Interest Purchase Agreement contains standard and customary representations of the parties and indemnification rights, subject in each case to a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;cap on aggregate indemnification. Upon the closing of the Membership Interest Purchase Agreement, we effectively obtained ownership of the Bango Plant, which we then sold to Safety-Kleen, and Bango Oil became a wholly-owned subsidiary of Vertex Refining Nevada.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Subscription Agreement:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On January 29, 2016, separate from and subsequent to the closing of the transactions contemplated by the Membership Interest Purchase Agreement, Fox Encore entered into a Subscription Agreement with the Company whereby Fox Encore subscribed for and purchased
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	44,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of newly-designated Series C Preferred Stock (as described below) in consideration for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	44,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of Series C Preferred Stock are convertible into
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4,400,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock subject to the terms of a Certificate of Designation of the Series C Preferred Stock (see terms of the Series C Preferred Stock described in greater detail below under &#8220;Item 5. Market for Registrant&#8217;s Common Equity, Related Stockholder Matters and Issuer Purchases of Equity Securities" - "Description of Capital Stock" - "Series C Convertible Preferred Stock").
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	$5.15 Million Promissory Note:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On January 29, 2016, following the closing of, and separate from the transactions contemplated by, the Membership Interest Purchase Agreement, Vertex OH, borrowed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$5.15 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;from Fox Encore and provided a Promissory Note to Fox Encore to reflect such borrowed funds (the &#8220;Fox Note&#8221;). The Fox Note bears interest at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	10%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;percent per annum (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	15%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;upon the occurrence of an event of default), payable monthly in arrears beginning on February 29, 2016. The principal and all accrued and unpaid interest on the Fox Note is due on the earlier of (a) July 31, 2016 (as may be extended by Vertex OH as discussed below, the &#8220;Maturity Date&#8221;), or (b) upon acceleration of the Fox Note during the existence of an event of default as discussed therein. Provided that no event of default is then existing on the Fox Note or under any other loan document associated therewith, and certain other requirements as described in the Fox Note are met, Vertex OH has the right to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	three
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;(3) extension options (each, an &#8220;Extension Option&#8221;) pursuant to which Vertex OH may extend the Maturity Date for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	six
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;(6) months each. The first extension will extend the Maturity Date of the Fox Note until January 31, 2017, the second extension will extend the Maturity Date of the Fox Note until
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-42
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage126"></A>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	July 31, 2017, and the third extension will extend the Maturity Date of the Fox Note until January 29, 2018. Upon exercising an Extension Option, Vertex OH is required to pay Fox Encore an extension fee equal to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the then outstanding principal amount of the Fox Note, which amount is separate from, and is not applied toward, the outstanding indebtedness owed under the Fox Note; provided, however, that if Vertex OH elects to exercise the Extension Option to extend the Maturity Date to January 31, 2017, the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	3%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;fee for such extension is not to be paid in cash but is instead added to the outstanding principal balance of the Fox Note. The Fox Note may be prepaid in whole or in part at any time without penalty, provided that if repaid in full by July 31, 2016, the amount to be repaid is decreased by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$150,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. The Fox Note is&#160;secured by the Mortgage described below.&#160;The Fox Note includes certain standard and customary financial reporting requirements, notice requirements, indemnification requirements, covenants and events of default. The Fox Note also includes a provision allowing the Lender (or any other lender party to the Restated Credit Agreement each as described below under &#8220;Amended and Restated Credit and Guaranty Agreement&#8221;) to purchase the Fox Note upon the occurrence of an event of default under the Restated Credit Agreement.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Open-End Mortgage, Security Agreement, Fixture Filing and Assignment of Leases and Rents:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On January 29, 2016, Vertex OH, entered into an Open-End Mortgage, Security Agreement, Fixture Filing and Assignment of Leases and Rents agreement (the &#8220;Mortgage&#8221;) with Fox Encore in order to secure the amount owed under the Fox Note discussed above. Pursuant to the Mortgage, Vertex OH granted Fox Encore a security interest in the Columbus, Ohio refinery owned by Vertex OH.&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Amended and Restated Credit and Guaranty Agreement:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	On January 29, 2016, we, Vertex Operating, certain of our other subsidiaries, Goldman Sachs Specialty Lending Holdings, Inc., as lender (&#8220;Lender&#8221;) and Goldman Sachs Bank USA, a New York State-Chartered Bank, as Administrative Agent, Lead Arranger and Collateral Agent (&#8220;Agent&#8221;) entered into an Amended and Restated Credit and Guaranty Agreement (the &#8220;Restated Credit Agreement&#8221;), which amended and restated that certain
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$40 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;Credit and Guaranty Agreement entered into between the parties on May 2, 2014 (as amended and modified to date, the &#8220;Credit Agreement&#8221;). The Restated Credit Agreement changed the Credit Agreement to an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$8.9 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;multi-draw term loan credit facility (of which approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$6.4 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was outstanding and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2.5 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;was available to be drawn pursuant to the terms of the Restated Credit Agreement on substantially similar terms as the currently outstanding amounts owed to the Lender); modified the Credit Agreement to adjust certain EBITDA calculations in connection with the purchase of Bango Oil and the sale of the Bango Plant as described above; provided for approval for us to exercise the Purchase Option, enter into and effect the transactions contemplated by the Membership Interest Purchase Agreement, Subscription Agreement, and the Sale Agreement, and allowed for the issuance of the Fox Note and the Mortgage; confirmed that we are required to make payments of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$800,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per quarter from June 30, 2016 through maturity (May 2, 2019); provided us a moratorium on the prepayment of amounts owed under the Restated Credit Agreement as a result of various financial ratios we are required to meet through December 31, 2016; provided for us to retain any business interruption insurance proceeds received in connection with the Bango Plant; provided for us to pay
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$16 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;received at closing from the sale of the Bango Assets, all amounts released from escrow and any other cash proceeds in excess of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$500,000
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;received from the Sale Agreement after closing to the Lender as prepayment of amounts due under the Restated Credit Agreement; allowed us the right to make certain permitted acquisitions moving forward, without further consent of the Lender, provided that among other requirements, such acquisitions are in the same business or line of business as the Company, that such acquired businesses have generated consolidated adjusted EBITDA for the four fiscal quarters preceding such acquisition in excess of capital expenditures for such period (taking into account adjustments acceptable to the Agent for synergies expected to be achieved within the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	90 days
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;following the closing of such acquisition), and that the funding for such acquisition comes from certain limited sources set forth in greater detail in the Restated Credit Agreement; adjusted certain fixed charge coverage ratios and leverage ratios we are required to meet on a quarterly basis from September 30, 2016 to maturity; required us to maintain at least
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$2 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of liquidity at all times; provided that events of default under the Credit Agreement include events of default under the Fox Note; and made various other updates and changes to take into account transactions which had occurred through the date of such agreement, and to remove expired and non-material terms of the prior Credit Agreement.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Series C Convertible Preferred Stock
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Series C Convertible Preferred Stock ("
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Series C Preferred Stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	"), authorized on January 29, 2016 as described above under
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	"Part I"-"Item 1, Business"-"Recent Events"-"Subscription Agreement"
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of this report, does not accrue a dividend, but has participation rights on an as-converted basis, to any dividends paid on the Company&#8217;s common stock (other than dividends paid solely in common stock). Each Series C Preferred Stock share has a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$100
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;face value, and a liquidation preference (in the amount of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$100
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share) which is junior to the Company&#8217;s previously outstanding shares of preferred stock, senior credit facilities and other debt holders as provided in further detail in the designation, but senior to the common stock.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	F-43
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
<A NAME="eolPage127"></A>
<BR>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Series C Preferred Stock is convertible into shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock at the holder&#8217;s option at any time at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	$1.00
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;per share (initially a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	100
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	:1 basis (subject to adjustments for stock splits and recapitalizations)). The Series C Preferred Stock votes together with the common stock on an as-converted basis (the "
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Voting Rights
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	"), provided that each holder&#8217;s voting rights are subject to and limited by the Series C Beneficial Ownership Limitation described below and provided further that notwithstanding any of the foregoing, solely for purposes of determining the Voting Rights, the Voting Rights accorded to such Series C Convertible Preferred Stock will be determined&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000333;">
	as if converted at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000333;">
	$1.05
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000333;">
	&#32;per share (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	the market value of the common stock as of the close of trading on the day prior to the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000333;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	original issuance date of the Series C Preferred Stock
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000333;">
	), and subject to equitable adjustment as discussed in the designation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	. There are no redemption rights associated with the Series C Preferred Stock.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	The Series C Preferred Stock contains a provision prohibiting the conversion of the Series C Preferred Stock into common stock of the Company, if upon such conversion or exercise, as applicable, the holder thereof would beneficially own more than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	4.999%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;of the Company&#8217;s then outstanding common stock (the &#8220;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Series C Beneficial Ownership Limitation
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#8221;). The Series C Beneficial Ownership Limitation may be increased up and down on a per holder basis, with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	61
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&#32;days prior written notice from any holder, provided the Series C Beneficial Ownership Limitation may never be higher than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	9.999%
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	So long as any shares of Series C Preferred Stock are outstanding, we are prohibited from undertaking any of the following without first obtaining the approval of the holders of a majority of the outstanding shares of Series C Preferred Stock: (a) increasing or decreasing (other than by redemption or conversion) the total number of authorized shares of Series C Preferred Stock; (b) re-issuing any shares of Series C Preferred Stock converted; (c) creating, or authorizing the creation of, or issuing or obligating the Company to issue shares of, any class or series of capital stock unless the same ranks junior to (and not pari passu with) the Series C Preferred Stock with respect to the distribution of assets on the liquidation, dissolution or winding up of the Company, or increasing the authorized number of shares of any additional class or series of capital stock unless the same ranks junior to (and not pari passu with) the Series C Preferred Stock with respect to the distribution of assets on the liquidation, dissolution or winding up of the Company; (d) effecting an exchange, reclassification, or cancellation of all or a part of the Series C Preferred Stock (except pursuant to the terms of the designation); (e) effecting an exchange, or creating a right of exchange, of all or part of the shares of another class of shares into shares of Series C Preferred Stock (except pursuant to the terms of the designation); (f) issuing any additional shares of Series C Preferred Stock; (g) altering or changing the rights, preferences or privileges of the shares of Series C Preferred Stock so as to affect adversely the shares of such series; or (h) amending or waiving any provision of the Company&#8217;s Articles of Incorporation or Bylaws relative to the Series C Preferred Stock so as to affect adversely the shares of Series C Preferred Stock in any material respect as compared to holders of other series of shares.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;PADDING-BOTTOM:16PX;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<BR>
</FONT>
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Item 9. Changes in and Disagreements With Accountants on Accounting and Financial Disclosure
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:120%;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:INHERIT;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">

</FONT>
